alert.note: Alert for Cottonwood; Jackson; Lyon; Murray; Nobles (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 12 at 3:08PM CDT until October 13 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM CDT THURSDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EASTERN PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA AND NORTHWEST IOWA... ...RED FLAG WARNING IS CANCELLED FOR THIS AFTERNOON FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EASTERN PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST MINNESOTA AND NORTHWEST IOWA... The National Weather Service in Sioux Falls has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon to 7 PM CDT Thursday. The Red Flag Warning has been cancelled. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...In Iowa, Osceola, Dickinson, O`Brien, Clay, Cherokee, Buena Vista and Ida. In Minnesota, Lyon, Murray, Cottonwood, Nobles and Jackson. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 21 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
